bibl.author: John Townsend Trowbridge
bibl.title: John Townsend Trowbridge to Walt Whitman, 30 April 1875
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p:
I think I have all of your books (2 or 3 Editions of some) except the last,—specified in my former note,—which alone I intended to ask for. That might be sent by mail. I note this because in your card you speak
of sending me books, & because I really desire only one.

I still go back occasionally to the old "Leaves of Grass" & find in them the same unfailing freshness & power, which repeated re‑readings in and wise, dull of the sense—a lust which only master studies in literature
can stand. They know my lust & me. I am thankful for them.
